critique: The document is an executive order regarding the exemption of Charles H. Hastings from mandatory retirement. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the government is functioning efficiently and effectively. There is a hint of surprise that an exception is being made. There is no explicit mention of joy, sadness, anger, fear, or disgust. The tone is formal and authoritative, aiming to convey a sense of stability and competence.
